title: Ticket #7069: Write out pool password by default
description:
We'd like to reduce the friction to setup and use TOKEN auth.

One way to do that is to setup a master password (POOL password) by default and set a default location for the pool password.

Given that TOKEN auth relies on all daemons having identical master passwords - and at least the central manager needs a master password - we should only do this in the collector daemon.
remarks:
2019-Aug-02 13:41:20 by tannenba:
Documentation currently states that a pool password will be written out if none exists on Linux. But looking quick at the code, there seems to be nothing Linux specific about any of this, so maybe the documentation is incorrect?

2019-Aug-05 10:32:11 by bbockelm:
I suspect all the code would work.

However, there is no default location provided in the param table for the password file for win32.
